alert.note: Alert for Phillips (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 3:50PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Phillips County through 430 PM CDT... At 349 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Logan, or 16 miles southeast of Norton, moving northeast at 15 mph. Another storm was developing southwest of Long Island as well. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Logan, Prairie View, Long Island and Woodruff. Most of the impacts from these storms will be noted along and near the Phillips and Norton county line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
